articles.content:
Floral Basket-Laying Function Held in Cuba 
    Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- A floral basket was laid with due ceremony before the portrait of President Kim Il Sung at Kim Il Sung Economic Special School in Cuba on Sept. 9 on the occasion of the 57th birthday of the DPRK.
 Present there were the chairman of the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, the principal of the school, personages of various strata, the DPRK ambassador to Cuba and staff members of the embassy in Havana.
 The participants laid the floral basket before the portrait of Kim Il Sung and paid homage to him.

articles.content:
Dissolution of "Security Investigation Team" Demanded in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The Family Movement for Realizing Democracy and other human rights organizations of south Korea reportedly made public a statement in demand of the dissolution of the "security investigation team" of the Police Office on Sept. 8.
 The statement charged that 8 billion won is annually squandered as expenses for the activities of the team which has a dense network of investigation throughout south Korea.    
 The team should be disbanded as it has been engaged in acts against reunification and people, standing on the first line for the upkeep of the successive regimes.

articles.content:
Kwak Pom Gi Meets Chinese Delegation 
    Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Vice-Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Kwak Pom Gi met and had a friendly talk with a delegation of the China State Electric Network Corporation headed by its President Liu Zhenya at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Friday.
 On hand were Minister Ju Tong Il and Vice-Minister Sin Yong Song of Electricity and Coal Industries and Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Wu Donghe and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.

IC Credit Card Introduced in DPRK
    Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The North East Asia Bank of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has introduced IC credit card.
 In order to modernize its settlement business, the bank has issued credit cards for the first time in the country with the help of the Information Technology Center No. 626.
 The IC card ensures the safety of the data registered in it. And it is impossible to counterfeit it so as to prevent money from being lost.    
 Six kinds of currencies can be deposited in a card at a time. With this card, one can exchange money instantly without going to a money exchange booth.
 A card can be shared by several persons (family members, relatives, friends, etc.).
 The bank enjoys popularity among depositors.

Multimedia "Korean Fine-Art Reflecting History"
    Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- A computer multimedia program "Korean Fine-Art Reflecting History" (1-2 vols.) has been recently produced by Kim Chaek University of Technology in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
 "In Search of Unknown Old Calligraphies" (Vol. 2) is got interested among calligraphers and overseas Koreans in particular.    
 It introduces more than 300 pieces of calligraphies created during the Ri Dynasty.
 The multimedia contains calligraphies written by kings of the Ri Dynasty and over 70 scholars, military officers and politicians famous in the history from the 15th to the early 20th century. It also carries modern Korean versions of the calligraphies written in Chinese characters. The multimedia consists of three parts -- two parts according to times and names and a part of general knowledge of calligraphy.
 The first two parts give works, brief history and anecdote of each calligrapher so as to give a general notion of the creator to people.    
 The part of general knowledge of calligraphy briefly explains about seal character, ornamental seal character, cursive writing, semicursive style of Chinese penmanship and printed style of writing to promote the understanding of the viewers.
 An overseas Korean resident said that it is worthy of a national treasure which makes Koreans have pride of ancestors' resourcefulness and talents and understanding of the history of calligraphic development.
